templates.description: Locked-In Retirement Account (LIRA) synthetic data template. A LIRA is a Canadian registered account designed to hold and invest pension assets from former employers. Investment income within the LIRA is tax-deferred until withdrawal. This template includes account details, investment options, locked-in rules, withdrawal policies, and eligibility requirements.

LIRA_ID.description: Unique identifier for the LIRA account (e.g., LIRA-654321).

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the LIRA account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the account holder.

SocialInsuranceNumber.description: Social Insurance Number (SIN) of the account holder.

EmployerName.description: Name of the former employer who contributed to the pension.

PensionPlanType.description: Type of pension plan transferred into the LIRA.

LIRAOpeningDate.description: Date when the LIRA account was established.

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the LIRA account.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the LIRA.

LockedInStatus.description: Indicates whether the funds in the LIRA are locked-in and cannot be accessed until retirement age.

MinimumWithdrawalAge.description: Minimum age at which the account holder can start making withdrawals, typically 55 or older, depending on pension legislation.

enum: Transfer to a Life Income Fund (LIF)
Transfer to a Locked-In Retirement Income Fund (LRIF)
Transfer to a Prescribed Retirement Income Fund (PRIF)

WithdrawalOptions.description: Available withdrawal options once the minimum age is reached.

UnlockingOptions.description: Special exceptions that allow for early withdrawal of LIRA funds.

SpousalConsentRequired.description: Indicates whether spousal or common-law partner consent is required for certain withdrawals.

TaxDeferredStatus.description: Indicates whether the investment income within the LIRA is tax-deferred until withdrawal.

templates.description: This template captures details of an insurance claim submission, linking it to a specific policy and categorizing it by claim type. It includes key details such as the claim amount, submission date, status, policyholder information, and a description of the claim. Additionally, it allows for the attachment of supporting documents, ensuring a comprehensive record for processing and review.

ClaimID.description: Unique identifier for the claim submission (e.g., CL-123456).

PolicyID.description: Policy ID associated with the claim. It follows a specific pattern depending on the claim type (e.g., DI-123456 for dental insurance).

ClaimType.description: Type of insurance claim being submitted.

ClaimAmountRequested.description: The amount of money being claimed by the policyholder.

ClaimDate.description: The date when the claim was submitted.

PolicyHolderName.description: Full name of the policyholder submitting the claim.

ClaimDetails.description: A brief description of the reason for the claim.

documentType.description: Type of supporting document (e.g., medical report, invoice, police report).

documentURL.description: URL or file path to the uploaded supporting document.

SupportingDocuments.description: List of documents submitted along with the claim.

templates.description: Synthetic data template for life insurance policies, including details about the life insurance contract, beneficiary information, and different types of life insurance policies such as term life and permanent life insurance.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the life insurance policy (e.g., LIFE-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Date when the life insurance policy was initiated.

PolicyEndDate.description: End date of the life insurance policy, applicable for term life insurance (N/A for permanent life).

PolicyType.description: The type of life insurance policy chosen by the policyholder.

CoverageAmount.description: The amount of coverage provided by the life insurance policy.

PremiumAmount.description: The premium amount paid by the policyholder on a regular basis (e.g., monthly, annually).

PremiumPaymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which premiums are paid.

PolicyRenewalOption.description: Indicates whether the policyholder has the option to renew the policy after the term expires (only applicable for Term Life).

CashValueOption.description: Indicates whether the policy offers a cash value option (primarily for Permanent Life).

CashValueAmount.description: The amount accumulated in the cash value account (only applicable for Permanent Life).

DeathBenefit.description: The amount that will be paid to the beneficiaries upon the policyholder's death.

items.description: Names of the beneficiaries who will receive the death benefit.

Beneficiaries.description: List of beneficiaries entitled to the death benefit.

PolicyHolderHealthStatus.description: Health status of the policyholder at the time of policy issuance.

Riders.description: Optional riders added to the policy to provide additional coverage or benefits.

RenewalPremiumIncrease.description: The percentage increase in premiums upon renewal (only applicable for Term Life).

UnderwritingClass.description: Underwriting class of the policyholder, based on their health and risk profile.

PolicyStatus.description: The current status of the life insurance policy.

PolicyHolderOccupation.description: Occupation of the policyholder, which may affect the policy's premiums or underwriting.

PolicyHolderSmokerStatus.description: Whether the policyholder is a smoker or non-smoker, which may impact premiums.

PolicyLoanOutstandingAmount.description: The outstanding loan amount against the policy, if applicable (for policies with cash value).

PolicyLoanInterestRate.description: The interest rate applied to any loans taken against the policy's cash value.

TaxPreferredGrowth.description: Indicates if the policy has tax-preferred growth on the accumulated cash value (relevant for Permanent Life).

AutomaticPremiumLoan.description: Indicates if the policy has an automatic premium loan feature to pay premiums from the policy’s cash value.

templates.description: First Home Savings Account (FHSA) synthetic data template. The FHSA is a registered investment account that allows Canadian residents to contribute up to $40,000 (with an annual contribution limit of $8,000) to buy their first home in Canada. Contributions are tax-deductible, and qualifying withdrawals are tax-free.

FHSA_ID.description: Unique identifier for the FHSA account (e.g., FHSA-123456).

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the FHSA account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the account holder.

SocialInsuranceNumber.description: Social Insurance Number (SIN) of the account holder.

ContributionLimit.description: Annual FHSA contribution limit ($8,000 per year).

CurrentContribution.description: Amount contributed in the current year.

AvailableContributionRoom.description: Remaining contribution room available to the account holder.

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the FHSA account.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the FHSA account was established.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the FHSA.

TaxDeduction.description: Indicates whether the FHSA contribution is tax-deductible.

ResidencyRequirement.description: Eligibility details: 'Canadian resident, aged 18 or older (19 in some provinces), under 71, and a first-time home buyer in the last four years.'

QualifyingHome.description: Type of home eligible for FHSA withdrawal (e.g., single-family, semi-detached, townhouse, condominium, co-operative housing).

WithdrawalTypes.description: Types of withdrawals from FHSA, either tax-free (qualifying) or taxable (non-qualifying).

WithdrawalTaxStatus.description: Indicates whether the withdrawal is tax-free (qualifying) or taxable (non-qualifying).

CarryForwardContributionRoom.description: Amount of unused FHSA contribution room carried forward to the next year.

templates.description: Synthetic data template for personal health insurance policies in Canada, including details about health coverage, plan types (Basic, Standard, Enhanced), covered expenses, and eligibility.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the personal health insurance policy (e.g., PHI-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Start date of the personal health insurance policy.

PolicyEndDate.description: End date of the personal health insurance policy (if applicable).

PolicyType.description: The type of personal health insurance policy chosen by the policyholder.

CoverageLimit.description: The maximum amount covered per year for the policyholder’s health expenses.

DeductibleAmount.description: The deductible amount that the policyholder must pay before the insurance coverage begins.

CoinsurancePercentage.description: The percentage of the medical expenses the policyholder must pay after the deductible is met.

PrescriptionDrugCoverage.description: Indicates whether prescription drug coverage is included in the plan.

DentalCareCoverage.description: Indicates whether dental care coverage (e.g., teeth cleanings, braces, crowns) is included in the plan.

VisionCareCoverage.description: Indicates whether vision care coverage (e.g., eye exams, glasses) is included in the plan.

EmergencyTravelCoverage.description: Indicates whether emergency travel medical services coverage is included (for out-of-country medical expenses).

PhysiotherapyCoverage.description: Indicates whether physiotherapy coverage for injury recovery is included in the plan.

MedicalEquipmentCoverage.description: Indicates whether medical equipment (e.g., mobility aids) coverage is included in the plan.

PolicyHolderEmploymentStatus.description: Employment status of the policyholder, which may affect their eligibility or need for personal health insurance.

EmployerCoverageTopUp.description: Indicates whether the policyholder is using this personal health insurance to top up their employer’s workplace plan.

PolicyHolderRetirementStatus.description: Indicates whether the policyholder is retired or nearing retirement.

items.description: List of exclusions that are not covered under the policy.

Exclusions.description: Exclusions under the personal health insurance policy (e.g., cosmetic procedures, pre-existing conditions).

HealthServicesIncluded.description: List of health services that are covered under the personal health insurance policy.

FamilyCoverageOption.description: Indicates whether the policyholder has opted for family coverage under the policy.

items.description: Names of family members covered under the policy, if applicable.

FamilyMembersCovered.description: List of family members covered under the personal health insurance policy.

PolicyStatus.description: Current status of the personal health insurance policy.

PolicyHolderOccupation.description: Occupation of the policyholder, which may impact the insurance premium or coverage options.

PreExistingConditionsCovered.description: Indicates whether pre-existing medical conditions are covered under the policy.

AdditionalRiders.description: Optional riders added to the policy to provide additional coverage.

PolicyPremiumAmount.description: The monthly or annual premium amount the policyholder pays for the health insurance.

PolicyPremiumFrequency.description: The frequency at which premiums are paid for the personal health insurance.

templates.description: Disability insurance synthetic data template. Disability insurance helps protect an individual’s income in case they are unable to work due to a medical illness, mental health issue, or injury. There are various types of disability insurance, including individual and group plans, and short-term and long-term disability plans.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the disability insurance policy (e.g., DI-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Date when the disability insurance policy was activated.

PolicyType.description: Type of disability insurance policy (Individual, Group, or Government).

CoverageType.description: Type of coverage the policyholder is enrolled in (Short-Term Disability or Long-Term Disability).

IncomeReplacementPercentage.description: Percentage of income replaced by the disability insurance policy, typically between 60% to 90%.

BenefitAmount.description: Amount of disability benefits paid to the policyholder.

BenefitStartDate.description: Date when the disability benefits begin after the qualifying event (e.g., injury, illness).

BenefitEndDate.description: Date when the disability benefits end, either due to recovery or the end of the benefit period.

MedicalCondition.description: Description of the medical condition that led to the disability claim (e.g., Major Depression, Injury, Cancer).

ClaimStatus.description: Current status of the disability claim (Approved, Pending, or Denied).

ClaimAmountPaid.description: Total amount paid out for the disability claim.

WaitingPeriod.description: Number of days before the disability benefits start, known as the waiting period.

TaxStatus.description: Tax status of the disability benefits (Taxable or Tax-Free).

DisabilityDuration.description: Duration of the disability period (in months).

RehabilitationSupport.description: Indicates whether rehabilitation support is provided as part of the policy.

CoverageLimit.description: Maximum coverage limit for the disability benefits.

templates.description: Synthetic data template for critical illness insurance policies, including details about covered illnesses, payout amounts, eligibility, and coverage options.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the critical illness insurance policy (e.g., CII-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Start date of the critical illness insurance policy.

PolicyEndDate.description: End date of the critical illness insurance policy (if applicable).

PolicyType.description: The type of critical illness insurance policy: Individual, Family, or Business.

CoverageAmount.description: The lump sum payout amount that the policyholder will receive if diagnosed with a covered critical illness.

enum: Major Organ Failure on Waiting List

CoveredIllnesses.description: List of critical illnesses covered under the policy.

FamilyCoverageOption.description: Indicates whether the policyholder has opted for family coverage under the policy.

items.description: Names of family members covered under the policy, if applicable.

FamilyMembersCovered.description: List of family members covered under the critical illness insurance policy.

CriticalIllnessClaimed.description: Indicates whether the policyholder has made a claim for a covered critical illness.

ClaimAmountPaid.description: The amount paid out for a claim, if applicable.

PremiumAmount.description: The monthly or annual premium amount the policyholder pays for the critical illness insurance.

PremiumFrequency.description: The frequency at which premiums are paid for the critical illness insurance.

WaitingPeriod.description: The waiting period in days before the policyholder can file a claim after being diagnosed with a covered critical illness.

items.description: List of exclusions under the policy (e.g., pre-existing conditions, cosmetic surgeries, etc.).

Exclusions.description: Exclusions from the critical illness insurance policy.

CashBackOption.description: Indicates whether the policyholder has opted for a cash-back option later in life.

PayoutFlexibility.description: The flexibility of how the lump sum payout can be used by the policyholder (e.g., for medical bills, mortgage payments, etc.).

PayoutDate.description: The date when the lump sum payout was made to the policyholder.

PolicyHolderOccupation.description: Occupation of the policyholder, which may impact the insurance premium or coverage options.

PreExistingConditionsCovered.description: Indicates whether pre-existing medical conditions are covered under the policy.

PolicyStatus.description: Current status of the critical illness insurance policy.

BusinessCoverage.description: Indicates whether the policyholder’s business is covered for key employees or business owners becoming critically ill.

BusinessContinuityCoverage.description: Indicates whether business continuity coverage is included in the critical illness insurance policy.

DebtRepaymentCoverage.description: Indicates whether debt repayment coverage is included in the critical illness insurance policy for business owners.

SuccessionPlanningCoverage.description: Indicates whether succession planning coverage is included in the critical illness insurance policy for business owners.

templates.description: This template captures details of customer service call transcripts between a customer and a call center agent. It includes key metadata such as caller and agent names, reason for the call, sentiment, product discussed, and the outcome. This data can be useful for analyzing customer satisfaction, identifying service trends, and improving agent performance.

CallID.description: Unique identifier for the call record (e.g., CALL-123456).

CallerName.description: Full name of the customer making the call.

AgentName.description: Full name of the call center agent handling the call.

ReasonForCall.description: Primary reason why the customer contacted the call center.

Product.description: The insurance or financial product related to the call.

Outcome.description: Outcome of the call from the customer's perspective.

AgentUpsellAttempt.description: Indicates if the agent attempted to upsell an additional product.

CallTranscript.description: A brief transcript or summary of key points discussed during the call.

templates.description: Mortgage protection insurance synthetic data template. Mortgage protection insurance is a life insurance policy that ensures your family or beneficiaries receive a tax-free death benefit to cover mortgage payments, debts, or other living expenses in the event of your death. The coverage lasts for a set term, typically through term life insurance.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the mortgage protection insurance policy (e.g., MP-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Date when the mortgage protection insurance policy became effective.

PolicyEndDate.description: Date when the mortgage protection insurance policy expires.

CoverageAmount.description: Amount of life insurance coverage provided to the policyholder's beneficiaries in the event of death.

PolicyType.description: Type of life insurance used for mortgage protection (typically term life insurance).

TermLength.description: Length of the term life insurance coverage, usually set in years (e.g., 10, 15, 20, or 30 years).

PremiumAmount.description: Monthly or annual premium paid for the mortgage protection insurance.

PaymentFrequency.description: Frequency at which the premium is paid (Monthly or Annually).

BeneficiaryName.description: Full name of the beneficiary who will receive the death benefit.

BeneficiaryRelationship.description: Relationship of the beneficiary to the policyholder (e.g., spouse, child, etc.).

MortgageAmountCovered.description: The amount of mortgage debt covered by the insurance in case of the policyholder's death.

MortgageLenderName.description: Name of the bank or mortgage lender associated with the policyholder's mortgage.

ClaimStatus.description: Current status of the mortgage protection insurance claim (Approved, Pending, or Denied).

ClaimAmountPaid.description: Amount paid out for claims made under the mortgage protection insurance policy.

PolicyRenewal.description: Indicates whether the policy is eligible for renewal at the end of the term.

RenewalTermLength.description: Length of the renewal term if the policy is renewed (in years).

DeathBenefitUsage.description: Primary use of the death benefit by the beneficiary (e.g., mortgage payments, debts, childcare, etc.).

PolicyHolderHealthStatus.description: The health status of the policyholder at the time of policy issuance (Healthy or Pre-Existing Condition).

Exclusions.description: List of exclusions in the policy, such as certain conditions that may not be covered.

templates.description: Registered Retirement Income Fund (RRIF) synthetic data template. A RRIF is a tax-deferred investment account in Canada that provides income during retirement. This template includes fields for account details, account holder information, transferred funds, withdrawals, taxation, and investment types.

RRIF_ID.description: Unique identifier for the RRIF account.

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the RRIF account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the RRIF account holder.

RRIFCreationDate.description: Date when the RRIF account was opened.

enum: Spouse's RRSP (due to death, separation, or divorce)
Spouse’s Employer DPSP (due to death, separation, or divorce)

FundingSource.description: List of sources from which funds were transferred to open the RRIF.

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the RRIF account.

AnnualMinimumWithdrawal.description: Required minimum withdrawal amount for the year.

WithholdingTaxApplied.description: Indicates if withholding tax was applied to the withdrawal (only applicable for withdrawals above the minimum amount).

Withdrawals.description: List of withdrawals made from the RRIF.

TaxOnWithdrawals.description: Total tax paid on withdrawals from the RRIF.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the RRIF.

CanConvertToRRSP.description: Indicates if the RRIF funds can be converted back to an RRSP (only applicable if the account holder is under 71).

MultipleRRIFs.description: Indicates if the account holder owns multiple RRIF accounts.

BeneficiaryName.description: Full name of the designated beneficiary upon account holder’s death.

BeneficiaryRelationship.description: Relationship of the beneficiary to the RRIF account holder.

RolloverEligibility.description: Indicates if the beneficiary is eligible for a tax-free rollover of the RRIF funds.

BeneficiaryOnDeath.description: Details of the beneficiary designated to receive RRIF funds upon the account holder’s death.

templates.description: Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) synthetic data template. An RRSP is a registered savings account in Canada that offers tax benefits and helps individuals save for retirement. This template includes fields for account holder details, contribution limits, tax benefits, borrowing options for home buying and education, and post-retirement options.

RRSP_ID.description: Unique identifier for the RRSP account.

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the RRSP account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the account holder.

ContributionLimit.description: Annual maximum contribution limit for the RRSP (e.g., $31,560 for 2024).

UnusedDeductionRoom.description: Unused RRSP deduction room carried forward from previous years.

HomeBuyersPlanAmount.description: Amount borrowed under the Home Buyers' Plan (up to a maximum of $60,000).

LifelongLearningPlanAmount.description: Amount borrowed per calendar year under the Lifelong Learning Plan (up to $10,000 per year, with a lifetime maximum of $20,000).

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the RRSP account.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the RRSP account was established.

AgeAtContributionStop.description: Age at which contributions to the RRSP stop (typically 71).

PostRetirementOption.description: The option selected at or after age 71: convert to a Registered Retirement Income Fund (RRIF), purchase an annuity, or opt for withdrawal.

Investments.description: List of investment types held within the RRSP.

templates.description: Business Owner Insurance synthetic data template. Business owner insurance provides coverage for business owners, their family, partners, and employees. It helps protect the business in the event of losing key personnel, provides health or life insurance for employees, and includes provisions for buy-sell agreements, estate planning, and minimizing tax liabilities during retirement or asset transfer.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the business owner insurance policy (e.g., BO-123456).

BusinessOwnerName.description: Full name of the business owner.

BusinessName.description: Name of the business the policyholder owns.

BusinessType.description: Type of business the owner operates (e.g., retail, consulting, manufacturing).

PolicyStartDate.description: Date when the business owner insurance policy became effective.

PolicyEndDate.description: Date when the business owner insurance policy expires.

CoverageAmount.description: Amount of insurance coverage provided for the business owner and associated coverage for employees, partners, and the business itself.

CoverageType.description: Type of coverage included in the business owner insurance (e.g., life, health, disability, buy-sell, key person).

PremiumAmount.description: Monthly or annual premium paid for the business owner insurance.

PaymentFrequency.description: Frequency at which the premium is paid (Monthly or Annually).

BuySellAgreementCoverage.description: Indicates if the policy includes coverage for a buy-sell agreement in case a business partner dies.

KeyPersonCoverage.description: Indicates if the policy includes key person insurance to protect against the loss of a critical team member.

EstatePlanningCoverage.description: Indicates if the policy includes provisions for estate planning, such as tax-efficient asset transfer.

EmployeeInsuranceCoverage.description: Indicates if the policy includes employee health or life insurance coverage.

LoanSecurityCoverage.description: Indicates if the policy can be used as collateral for securing a business loan.

RetirementPlanningCoverage.description: Indicates if the policy includes coverage for minimizing tax bills during retirement.

PolicyHolderTaxMinimization.description: Indicates if the policy provides tax minimization strategies for the policyholder when drawing from corporate assets.

PolicyHolderBusinessAssets.description: Total value of business assets to be used as security or to fund estate planning.

name.description: Full name of the business partner.

relationship.description: Relationship of the partner to the business owner (e.g., co-owner, silent partner).

BusinessPartners.description: List of business partners included in the insurance policy, if applicable.

name.description: Full name of the beneficiary who will receive the insurance payout.

relationship.description: Relationship of the beneficiary to the business owner (e.g., spouse, child, business partner).

sharePercentage.description: Percentage of the payout that the beneficiary will receive.

Beneficiaries.description: List of beneficiaries for the life insurance payout in the event of the business owner's death.

ClaimStatus.description: Current status of the business owner insurance claim (Approved, Pending, or Denied).

ClaimAmountPaid.description: Amount paid out for claims made under the business owner insurance policy.

PolicyRenewal.description: Indicates whether the policy is eligible for renewal at the end of the term.

RenewalTermLength.description: Length of the renewal term if the policy is renewed (in years).

templates.description: Tax-Free Savings Account (TFSA) synthetic data template. A TFSA is a registered investment account designed to help Canadians save money with tax-free growth and withdrawals. This template includes account details, contribution limits, investment types, withdrawal policies, and eligibility requirements.

TFSA_ID.description: Unique identifier for the TFSA account (e.g., TFSA-123456).

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the TFSA account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the account holder.

SocialInsuranceNumber.description: Social Insurance Number (SIN) of the account holder.

CurrentContribution.description: Amount contributed in the current year.

AvailableContributionRoom.description: Remaining contribution room available to the account holder.

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the TFSA account.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the TFSA account was established.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the TFSA.

WithdrawalPolicy.description: Information on the TFSA withdrawal policy. Withdrawals are tax-free and may be subject to investment-specific restrictions.

ResidencyRequirement.description: Eligibility details: typically 'Canadian resident, aged 18 or older with a Social Insurance Number (SIN)'.

templates.description: Synthetic data template for long-term care insurance policies, including details about the type of care, coverage options, benefits, and eligibility for various stages of life.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the long-term care insurance policy (e.g., LTCI-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Start date of the long-term care insurance policy.

PolicyEndDate.description: End date of the long-term care insurance policy (if applicable).

PolicyType.description: The type of long-term care insurance policy: Individual or Family.

CoverageAmount.description: The monthly or weekly benefit payout amount from the long-term care insurance policy.

CareTypeCovered.description: List of care types covered under the long-term care insurance policy.

AgeRange.description: Age range of the policyholder when applying for the long-term care insurance policy.

BenefitsPaidFrequency.description: Frequency of the benefit payments made under the long-term care insurance policy.

BenefitsAmount.description: The range of the benefit paid, which can be between $125 and $2,300 per week.

enum: Substantial Assistance with Activities of Daily Living
Stand-by Assistance for Bathing and Transferring
EligibilityCriteria.description: Eligibility criteria for receiving long-term care insurance benefits.

CareLocationOption.description: Locations where care can be received under the long-term care insurance policy.

LTCIClaimMade.description: Indicates whether the policyholder has made a claim under the long-term care insurance policy.

ClaimStartDate.description: The date when the policyholder started receiving long-term care benefits.

ClaimEndDate.description: The date when the policyholder stopped receiving long-term care benefits (if applicable).

PremiumAmount.description: The monthly or annual premium amount the policyholder pays for the long-term care insurance.

PremiumFrequency.description: The frequency at which premiums are paid for the long-term care insurance.

CashBenefitOption.description: Indicates whether the policyholder has chosen a cash benefit option instead of reimbursement for care expenses.

WealthProtection.description: Indicates whether the policy includes protection against the erosion of wealth due to care costs.

StressRelief.description: Indicates whether the policy aims to relieve the emotional, physical, and financial stress on the policyholder’s children and caregivers.

PolicyHolderHealthStatus.description: Current health status of the policyholder, which may impact eligibility or premiums.

PreExistingConditionsCovered.description: Indicates whether pre-existing medical conditions are covered under the policy.

PolicyStatus.description: Current status of the long-term care insurance policy.

templates.description: Travel insurance synthetic data template. Travel insurance helps protect travelers from unexpected medical expenses and other emergencies while traveling outside their home province or country. Coverage includes emergency medical care, trip interruption, flight delay assistance, and optional coverage for sports and activities.

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the travel insurance policy (e.g., TI-123456).

PolicyHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the policyholder.

PolicyStartDate.description: Date when the travel insurance policy became effective.

PolicyEndDate.description: Date when the travel insurance policy expires.

Destination.description: Destination(s) of the trip covered under the policy.

CoverageType.description: Type of travel insurance coverage (Single Trip, Multi Trip, or Visitor to Canada).

EmergencyMedicalCoverage.description: Indicates whether emergency medical coverage is included in the policy.

TripInterruptionCoverage.description: Indicates whether trip interruption coverage is included in the policy.

FlightDelayAssistance.description: Indicates whether flight delay assistance is included, offering lounge access or payout if delayed over 2 hours.

SportsAndActivitiesCoverage.description: Indicates whether coverage for sports and extreme activities is included in the policy.

SuperVisaInsurance.description: Indicates whether Super Visa insurance is included for visitors to Canada.

MedicalEvacuationCoverage.description: Indicates whether medical evacuation coverage is included in the policy.

PolicyPremium.description: Total premium amount paid for the travel insurance policy.

PaymentPlan.description: The payment plan for the insurance premium (One-Time Payment or Installments).

PremiumAmount.description: Amount of premium paid for the policy, per installment or as a lump sum.

TripStartDate.description: Start date of the insured trip.

TripEndDate.description: End date of the insured trip.

TripLength.description: Duration of the trip covered by the policy (in days).

PolicyCoverageLimit.description: Maximum coverage limit for emergency medical expenses and other covered incidents.

FlightDelayDuration.description: Duration of the flight delay, in hours, that triggers assistance coverage.

ClaimStatus.description: Current status of the travel insurance claim (Approved, Pending, or Denied).

ClaimAmountPaid.description: Total amount paid out for claims made under the travel insurance policy.

templates.description: Registered Education Savings Plan (RESP) synthetic data template. An RESP is a tax-deferred account in Canada designed to help save for a child’s post-secondary education. This template includes fields for plan details, account holder and beneficiary information, contribution limits, government grants, and eligible education expenses.

RESP_ID.description: Unique identifier for the RESP account.

PlanType.description: Type of RESP account: Individual or Family.

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the RESP account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the RESP account holder.

BeneficiaryDOB.description: Date of birth of the beneficiary.

RelationshipToHolder.description: Relationship of the beneficiary to the RESP account holder.

Beneficiaries.description: List of beneficiaries associated with the RESP.

TotalContribution.description: Total contributions made to the RESP, with a lifetime limit of $50,000 per beneficiary.

CESGReceived.description: Total Canada Education Savings Grant (CESG) received, with a lifetime maximum of $7,200 per beneficiary.

BCTESG.description: B.C. Training and Education Savings Grant (BCTESG), up to $1,200.

QESI.description: Québec Education Savings Incentive (QESI), with a lifetime maximum of $3,600.

ProvincialGrants.description: Provincial grants received under the RESP.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the RESP.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the RESP account was established.

EligibleExpenses.description: List of eligible education expenses covered by RESP withdrawals.

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the RESP account.

WithdrawnAmount.description: Total amount withdrawn from the RESP for educational expenses.

WithdrawnBy.description: Who withdrew the funds: the beneficiary or the account holder.

templates.description: Life Income Fund (LIF) synthetic data template. A LIF is a type of Registered Retirement Income Fund (RRIF) that provides income from locked-in pension assets during retirement. LIFs have specific withdrawal rules based on federal or provincial pension laws, and they provide tax-deferred savings with flexible investment options. Survivor's benefits are available for spouses or beneficiaries upon death.

LIF_ID.description: Unique identifier for the Life Income Fund account (e.g., LIF-123456).

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the account holder.

LIFBalance.description: Current total balance of the Life Income Fund.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the LIF account was established.

LIFTransferDate.description: Date when assets were transferred into the LIF account.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the LIF.

WithdrawalStartDate.description: Date when withdrawals from the LIF began.

AnnualWithdrawalAmount.description: Annual amount withdrawn from the LIF.

WithdrawalType.description: Indicates whether the withdrawal is qualifying or non-qualifying.

AnnualWithdrawalLimit.description: Annual withdrawal limit based on federal or provincial pension law.

SurvivorBenefits.description: Indicates whether survivor's benefits are available for the account holder's spouse or beneficiaries.

BeneficiaryName.description: Full name of the beneficiary if applicable.

Province.description: Province where the LIF account is held, which may influence withdrawal rules.

SpouseConsentRequired.description: Indicates whether the account holder's spouse or common-law partner's consent is required to open the LIF.

TaxDeferredStatus.description: Indicates whether the LIF is tax-deferred until withdrawals are made.

WithdrawalTaxStatus.description: Indicates whether the withdrawal is tax-free or taxable.

LIFMaturityAge.description: The age at which the account holder reaches maturity for LIF withdrawal rules.

templates.description: Dental Insurance synthetic data template. Dental insurance provides coverage for various dental care procedures such as cleanings, x-rays, exams, orthodontics, and dental repairs like crowns and dentures. It is offered as part of Personal Health Insurance (PHI) plans with varying coverage levels (Basic, Standard, Enhanced).

PolicyID.description: Unique identifier for the dental insurance policy (e.g., DI-123456).

PolicyHolderName.description: Full name of the individual covered under the dental insurance policy.

CoveragePlan.description: The type of Personal Health Insurance (PHI) plan selected by the policyholder (Basic, Standard, or Enhanced).

PolicyStartDate.description: The start date of the dental insurance policy.

PolicyEndDate.description: The end date or expiration date of the dental insurance policy.

PremiumAmount.description: Monthly or annual premium amount paid for the dental insurance coverage.

PaymentFrequency.description: Frequency at which the dental insurance premium is paid (Monthly or Annually).

procedure.description: List of dental procedures covered under the policy.

DentalProceduresCovered.description: List of dental procedures covered by the policyholder's dental insurance plan.

OrthodonticsCoverage.description: Indicates if the dental insurance policy includes coverage for orthodontics (braces for adults and children).

AnnualCoverageLimit.description: Annual limit on coverage amount for dental procedures.

ClaimAmountPaid.description: Amount paid out for dental insurance claims made during the policy year.

ClaimStatus.description: Current status of a dental insurance claim (Approved, Pending, or Denied).

name.description: Full name of the dependent covered under the dental insurance policy.

relationship.description: Relationship of the dependent to the policyholder (e.g., spouse, child).

DependentsCovered.description: List of dependents covered by the dental insurance policy.

IsCDCPEligible.description: Indicates if the policyholder is eligible for the Canadian Dental Care Plan (CDCP).

BasicPlanCoverage.description: Indicates if the Basic PHI plan includes dental coverage.

StandardPlanCoverage.description: Indicates if the Standard PHI plan includes dental coverage.

EnhancedPlanCoverage.description: Indicates if the Enhanced PHI plan includes dental coverage.

PHIPlanComparison.description: Details comparing the different levels of PHI coverage for dental procedures.

PolicyRenewal.description: Indicates whether the dental insurance policy is eligible for renewal at the end of the term.

RenewalTermLength.description: Length of the renewal term if the policy is renewed (in years).

PolicyHolderTaxMinimization.description: Indicates if the policyholder can use the insurance to minimize tax liabilities related to health care expenses.
